^\Qtitle: A Review of Space Leaks in Haskell subtitle: CS490 Seminar Report, Spring 2020 author:
Michael Reed: institute: George Mason University class: CS490 date: Spring 2020 bibliography: bibliography.bib csl: csl/acm-sig-proceedings.csl link-citations: true ...\E$

^\QHaskell is pure, which means that functions in Haskell have no side effects @lipovaca_learn_2011.^This is mostly true, but Haskell does support functions with side-effects through the \EDummy[0-9]+\Q (read as "input output") monad.\E$
